event.doc_name: Order Approving and Entering Consent Decree

evidence.text: The Jail will provide constitutionally adequate medical care.

Within one year of the Effective Date, housing for prisoners with SMI will be provided in general population, mental health units, secure mental health units, and acute mental health units as outlined below.

add_extracted.value: Ensure prisoners with serious mental illness receive appropriate housing

evidence.text: The Jail will maintain a mental health registry that identifies all prisoners with serious mental illness, the diagnosis, the date of their last visit with a Qualified Mental Health Professional or Mental Health Professional, and, when applicable, the date of their next visit.

add_extracted.value: Maintain a mental health registry for prisoners with serious mental illness

evidence.text: This Agreement will terminate in five years, or earlier, if the Parties agree that HRRJ has attained substantial compliance with all provisions of this Agreement and maintained that compliance for a period of one year
The Monitor will conduct an on-site inspection and issue a Monitoring Report for HRRJ six months after the baseline Monitoring Report, and then every six months thereafter.

add_extracted.value: Monitor reports filed every six months

evidence.text: UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, Plaintiff
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, Plaintiff
HAMPTON ROADS REGIONAL JAIL AUTHORITY, Defendant

add_extracted.value: Defendant: Hampton Roads Regional Jail Authority

evidence.text: ORDER: The joint motion ECF 2 is GRANTED. The Agreement is APPROVED and the Agreement's terms are hereby incorporated into this Order as if fully set forth herein. Signed by District Judge Rebecca Beach Smith on 8/31/20.
The Court retains complete jurisdiction of this matter to enforce this Order and the terms of the incorporated Agreement until the Defendants have fulfilled their obligations therein.
evidence.source_document: Order Approving and Entering Consent Decree

event.doc_name: Memorandum of Law in Support of Joint Motion to Dismiss

evidence.text: Case 2:20-cv-00410-RBS-LRL   Document 2-1   Filed 08/05/20   Page 1 of 32 PageID# 15

The Jail has failed to provide constitutionally adequate medical care to inmates, including those with serious mental illness, in violation of the Eighth Amendment to the United States Constitution and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973.

add_extracted.value: The Hampton Roads Regional Jail Authority failed to provide constitutionally adequate medical care to inmates, including those with serious mental illness, resulting in violations of the Eighth Amendment and the Rehabilitation Act.
